Takeru & Matt:

Thanks for the report of this issue.

I confirmed there were some problems with both the admin-UI editing of 
seeds, and the reading of seeds from disk, that corrupted seed URLs 
specified with multibyte UTF-8 characters.

Fixes have been applied to the H1 and H3 code trees, so the latest 
test/developer builds shouldn't have a problem.

A possible workaround in earlier versions, at least with respect to 
characters in domain-names (if not the URL path portion), would be to 
preconvert to IDN punycode before specifying as seeds.

There shouldn't be similar problems in URLs discovered via crawling -- 
they go by another path unaffected by this bug, and indeed that was how 
the Heritrix IDN support was initially tested.

I don't know of any situations where content or URL-encoding issues 
prevent Heritrix from finding or properly interpreting page outlinks 
with multibyte characters in URL domain or path/query segments --
but given the wide variety of encodings and formats used/ 
reported-by-servers/ detected-by-browsers on the web, there could still 
be combinations where there are problems. Please let us know if you ever 
suspect any problems and we'll investigate right away.

- Gordon @ IA

Matthew Warhaftig wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi Takeru,
> 
> Heritrix automatically converts Internationalized Domain Name seeds and 
> discovered links to punycode.  However, I recreated your issue of 
> certain IDN seeds getting ignored and in response opened HER-1711 
> <https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1711>.
> 
> Non-ASCII character s in the file path to Heritrix is not a problem. 
>  Also, I did not encounter any other IDN related issues during my testing.
> 
> Thanks,
> Matt
> 
> 
> On Nov 16, 2009, at 6:27 AM, takeru sasaki wrote:
> 
>>  
>>
>> Hi,
>>
>> I want to know about IDN support of heritrix.
>> ("Internationalized domain name"
>> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internationalized_Domain_Name 
>> <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internationalized_Domain_Name>)
>>
>> I was tried to add Japanese-IDN host to seeds, and failed to crawl.
>> At "seed report" page, I met this message.
>> ----- http://myheritrix/reports/seeds.jsp?job=xxxxxxx 
>> <http://myheritrix/reports/seeds.jsp?job=xxxxxxx>
>> Some items in seed specification were ignored. This may not indicate
>> any problem, but the ignored items are displayed here for reference:
>> -----
>>
>> And I try to add Punycode of failed one.
>> It is success for seed report. and looks like good for crawling
>> relative links...
>>
>> I want to know:
>> - Can I add IDN url to seed?
>> - Is Heritrix run correct when IDN-url is found in crawled HTMLs?
>> - Is Heritrix run correct when not-ASCII chars in path string?
>> - any other non-ASCII URL problem?
>> - if NOT, Is it hard to add IDN-support to Heritrix? I need it.
>>
>> I am using version 1.14.3.
>>
>> Thank you for read my message.
>>
>> takeru
>>
> 
> 
> 
>
